*div1 type="summary"* *p*J. E. B. Austin to Mrs. Emily Perry, June 3, 1825. Hopeful condition of Province. Austin's plans. Priest coming to organize a church.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p*Prov. Texas*/p* *p**location_mentioned*Groces Retreat*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="06-03-1825">June 3d 1825.*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*My Dear *person_mentioned*Sister*/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*I receivd your welcome letter under date of *date_mentioned n="04-10-1825">10th of April*/date_mentioned*, while on a visit to this place and hasten to answer it, before I leave this; as opportunities more frequently occur from here, than *location_mentioned*San Felipe*/location_mentioned**/p*
*p*Not long since I wrote you; and *person_mentioned*Stephen */person_mentioned*at the same time forwarded an answer to*person_mentioned* Mr. Perry*/person_mentioned*'s letter, which no doubt you will receive in due time— You mention that a letter from *person_mentioned*Stephen */person_mentioned*dated in *date_mentioned n="12-xx-1824">Decemr. last*/date_mentioned* which you received, gave you more Satisfaction (with respect to his reconciliation, of your choice of a *person_mentioned*partner*/person_mentioned*) than any before received, on that subject. Let me assure you My dear *person_mentioned*Sister */person_mentioned*that he is not only reconciled but pleased, much pleased, with your Choice—knowing as he does, that you would not take so impor- tant a step without consulting your happiness; The only objects dear to us on this Earth being yourself and lovely little *person_mentioned*family*/person_mentioned*, rest assured whenever you are happy we shall be perfectly so—Our *person_mentioned*Brother*/person_mentioned* seems to think, owing to the yet infant state of the *location_mentioned*Settlement */location_mentioned*that it would not be altogether advisable, for *person_mentioned*Mr. P. */person_mentioned*to remove to this *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*, at present—there is nothing he could do, that would be advantageous to him, for some years to come—tho I hope the *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*will so far improve in the course [of] a very [few] years, that it will attract the attention of *person_mentioned*Mr. Perry*/person_mentioned*—and be so much to his interest that he will be induced to relinquish the cold and unfriendly Climate of *location_mentioned*Mo.*/location_mentioned* for the more mild and salubrious one of *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*, where I think the mildness of the Climate tends in some degree to Soften the feelings of Man and render him more like a natural Being— Indeed my dear *person_mentioned*Emily */person_mentioned*it certainly, will be " the most joyful period of our lives" when we can embrace our *person_mentioned*Sister */person_mentioned*with " peace and plenty " smiling around us after the many vicissitudes we have passed through for the last Six years—The time is not far distant, if our lives are spared, when the fond vision will be realized.*/p*
*p*I am happy to hear *person_mentioned*Cousin Adeline*/person_mentioned* has changed the name of *person_mentioned*Bates */person_mentioned*for that of *person_mentioned*Lewis*/person_mentioned*, and also that she has so soon commenced housekeeping, may her life be long—prosperous and happy—and may " misfortune not mark her for her one." You will greet her with a kiss for me when you meet her—You were " pleased and provoked " at my brevity in one of my last letters, and think that I can never be at a loss for a subject when writing to my *person_mentioned*Sister*/person_mentioned*—You will please to excuse that letter and I will try and be more prolix in future. I must have been in one of my Lazy Moods when I wrote—*person_mentioned*Stephen*/person_mentioned* has not gone to the *location_mentioned*City of Saltillo*/location_mentioned*, probably he will not go untill *date_mentioned n="Fall-1825">fall*/date_mentioned*, as he is fully determined to close the affairs of the *location_mentioned*Colony*/location_mentioned* before he makes his return to *person_mentioned*Govt*/person_mentioned*, he can obtain the settling of 500 or 600 *person_mentioned*families */person_mentioned*more, by making application—Everything goes on finely; not withstanding the unfavorable season we have had, good crops will be made— The *person_mentioned*Priest*/person_mentioned* will be on in a few days to organize a *location_mentioned*church */location_mentioned*and attend to our spiritual affairs—Draw no conclusions from the date of my letter I am merely on a visit of a few days, because I pass my time so heavy at *location_mentioned*home*/location_mentioned*—and also, because it is a pleasure to visit a *person_mentioned*family */person_mentioned*I esteem so highly as I do this. Present my respects to *person_mentioned*Brother James*/person_mentioned*—and kiss my charming little *person_mentioned*niece*/person_mentioned*, tell the *person_mentioned*Boys */person_mentioned*to study hard, and *person_mentioned*uncle */person_mentioned*will not forget any of them *person_mentioned*Brother */person_mentioned*sends his love Your Affectionate Brother*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Jas. E. B. Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*I forgot to mention in one of my former letters that *person_mentioned*Robt Andrews */person_mentioned*was dead He has been dead nearly a year*/p*
*p*(Addressed:) *person_mentioned*Mrs. Emily M. Perry*/person_mentioned* Mail *location_mentioned*Potosi, Missouri*/location_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
